Issues.Title: docs: declare NgOptimizedImage APIs as stable
Issues.Body:
In v14.2, we've introduced a new directive to help developers to configure images for better performance. The directive was initially released in the "developer preview" mode. We've collected the feedback, made several improvements and we are happy to announce that the NgOptimizedImage APIs are promoted to stable!

This commit updates vast majority of APIs to drop the `@developerPreview` label, which effectively documents them as stable.

There are few APIs though that retained the `@developerPreview` annotations:
- the `IMAGE_CONFIG` token
- the `ImageConfig` type
- the `fill` @Input of the directive

We plan to collect some additional feedback for the mentioned APIs and drop the `@developerPreview` annotation after that.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Documentation content changes

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs: declare NgOptimizedImage APIs as stable" (#47794)

Issues.Title: Add a function to provide ServiceWorker support without referencing NgModules
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

service-worker

### Description

Based on https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/47754#issuecomment-1279952755.

We need to provide a function (like `provideServiceWorkerSupport`) to replace [the `ServiceWorkerModule.register` call](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/service-worker/src/module.ts#L166-L186), so that there is no need to import and use NgModule in standalone use-cases.

Issues.Title: Router's popstate listener incompatible with asynchronous route configs and when popstate fires on page load (a safari bug)
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? router ### Is this a regression? No ### Description We're loading routes via CMS before manually triggering an initialNavigation. Generally this works but if the browser tab crashes due to using too much memory, the page will reload but perform an initial navigation before the routes are registered, causing a white screen of death. After spending days debugging this (due to tab crashing and not being able to log anything) I've worked out that this is the ordering of events: - NavigationStart (popstate with restoredState) - NavigationError (Cannot match any routes) - Add routes and call `router.initialNavigation()` This is how we configure the router: ```ts RouterModule.forRoot([], { initialNavigation: 'disabled', onSameUrlNavigation: 'reload', paramsInheritanceStrategy: 'always', scrollPositionRestoration: 'top', relativeLinkResolution: 'corrected', }), ``` When comparing our site to competitors in the same industry, every other website is able to gracefully recover from a crashed tab except for ours which is the only Angular site. If it's expected behaviour then I'm not sure how we're meant to workaround it apart from get a white screen and expect the user ot refresh. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://github.com/intellix/angular-router-crash-initial-nav-bug ### Please provide the exception or error you saw I've downloaded the Tour of Heroes zip, pushed it as a commit and then my reproduction on top of that here for the exact changes: https://github.com/intellix/angular-router-crash-initial-nav-bug/commit/107da944332a627316fda72dfcdd7e2a02dae600#diff-2d2675bb4687601a5c7ccf707455132f90f3516a33716185687e5c41df59ac7d To reproduce: ```sh git clone git@github.com:intellix/angular-router-crash-initial-nav-bug.git cd angular-router-crash-initial-nav-bug npm i npm run dev:ssr --host=0.0.0.0 ifconfig | grep inet // grab your IP address ``` Then go to it on your iPhone using your IP address on the same network (if you do it on desktop, the tab doesn't really crash and restart the same). Go to heroes and click the "Crash browser tab" button. You'll notice that it didn't refresh on the current route and it couldn't match a route. If you go to connect with Safari Developer Tools, you can see the list of events that occured as they're being stored (you can't use logs as the browser crashes entirely): ``` window.appEvents ``` That will look something like so: ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular: 13.1.3 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... platform-server, router Also tried with 14 and it's the same thing. ``` ### Anything else? Temporary workaround: **route.service.ts:** ```ts export class RouteService { events$ = this.router.events.pipe(shareReplay({ refCount: true, bufferSize: 1 })); constructor(private router: Router) {} } ``` **cms-route.service.ts:** ```ts setup() { // Add routes from CMS this.router.config.unshift(...configs); this.router.config.push({ path: '**', outlet: 'primary', pathMatch: 'full', redirectTo: '', }); this.router.initialNavigation(); // Force a navigation if an initial navigation happened before routes were registered this.routeService.events$ .pipe(take(1), filter(isNavigationError)) .subscribe(event => this.router.navigateByUrl(event.url)); } ``` Sorry for opening a nearly identical issue to https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/47785 - I was asked to do so with a reproduction so here it is
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Router's popstate listener incompatible with asynchronous route configs and when popstate fires on page load (a safari bug)" (#47789)

Issues.Title: initialNavigation: 'enabledBlocking' with empty path breaks routing
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When I have this:
`RouterModule.forRoot(appRoutes, {
      initialNavigation: 'enabledBlocking',
`
and an app route like this:
`{
    path: 'jobs',
    loadChildren: () =>
      import('./jobs/jobs.module').then(m => m.JobsModule)
  },`
and then in the JobsModule, this:
`{
    path: '',
    component: JobsComponent,
    pathMatch: 'full'
  },`

the JobsComponent gets loaded, but then all router links and calls to `router.navigate(...)` do nothing. I've enabled route tracing, and the routes appear to get resolved fine, but nothing updates in the UI. If I remove the `initialNavigation: 'enabledBlocking',` or set the path in the JobsModule to a non-empty string, the routing works.

This used to work in Angular 12, but broke when I upgraded to Angular 14.

Any ideas?

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
All router links or calls to navigate did not change the UI.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 14.2.6
Node: 16.15.1
Package Manager: npm 8.13.1 
OS: linux x64

Angular: 14.2.6
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... platform-server, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1402.6

@angular-devkit/core            14.2.6
```

Issues.Title: How can I use a route's resolve data in a title resolver?
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

router

### Description


How can I access a route's resolver data in the route's title resolver?

I want to dynamically set my route's title, using the data from the resolver. For example, my route is to view a product, and I get the product data via a route resolver (ProductResolverService below), and I want my route title to be 'Product X', where X would come from the resolve data. I've tried below but the route.data is undefined.

```
{ title: ProductNameTitleResolver, resolve: { product: ProductResolverService } } // Route

@Injectable()
export class ProductNameTitleResolver implements Resolve<string> {
  resolve(route: ActivatedRouteSnapshot, state: RouterStateSnapshot): string | Promise<string> | Observable<string>  {
    const productData = route.data['product'] // Unfortunately this is undefined
    return `Product ${productData.name}`
  }
}
```

This would be useful to eliminate the need to make two http calls in this situation (one for the route-resolver and one for the title-resolver).

### Proposed solution

Populate route-resolver data into title-resolvers' route.data.

### Alternatives considered

None
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How can I use a route's resolve data in a title resolver?" (#47781)

Issues.Title: feat(language-service): Allow auto-imports to suggest multiple possible imports.
Issues.Body: This change allows the language service to suggest imports for *all* directives returned from the compiler, and for *all* import specifiers for each directive. The first change has immediate effect, since there could already be multiple directives with the same selector. The second change is future-proofing; the compiler currently only returns a single best specifier, but will return more in the future.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(language-service): Allow auto-imports to suggest multiple possible imports." (#47787)

Issues.Title: Breaking changes in Angular version 12: Broken TypeScript entry
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

[The _Breaking changes in Angular version 12_ section of the _Updating to Version 12 page_](https://v12.angular.io/guide/updating-to-version-12#breaking-changes-in-angular-version-12) starts with:

> Add support for TypeScript 4.2. TypeScript <4.2.3 is no longer supported. The supported range of TypeScript versions is 4.2.3 to 4.2.x. See [...]

There are obviously several things wrong, but I will not file a ticket for each, so please basically take this as a request to review that entry. I will file further tickets in case something is missed.

Specific issues and observations:

- The removal of support for TypeScript < 4.2.3 and the addition of support for TypeScript 4.2 (if this makes sense) should be treated separately.
- It would be best to have a section dedicated to breaking changes and deprecations.
- "The supported range of TypeScript versions is 4.2.3 to 4.2.x." should be moved, perhaps to [_Angular versioning and releases_](https://angular.io/guide/releases), or at least fixed.
- The list of issues on that page usually uses proper sentences, but has several elements like "Add support for TypeScript 4.2" and lacks uniformity.

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

https://v12.angular.io/guide/updating-to-version-12#breaking-changes-in-angular-version-12

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

Changes in Angular version 12

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

Reading the changes in Angular version 12

I am not sure what is expected to be in this field. An example would clarify.

Issues.Title: Evalution of *ngIf-Directive is not synced to template code inside of that *ngIf-block
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I don't know why I'm only noticing this now and not earlier after having worked with Angular for some time.
Maybe it's also some configuration (strict, angular-setting) that I am doing wrong, but I think not.

It seems to me that the evalution of *ngIf-Directive is not synced to template code inside of that *ngIf-block.
If I have an ngIf-Directive then all the html template code inside of that if-block only gets executed when the if-statement evaluates to true. So if I check in the *ngIf-Directive a variable and the if-statement evaluates to true then it should be save to use that variable inside the *ngIf-block without checking it again (in this example with optional chaining). Don't know how to describe it more precise so I added a stackblitz demo where everything is shown and commented.

Note:
It appears to me that Angular interprets each statement in a template file separately instead of one nested block (AST) like in every programming language. Maybe that's the reason why I have to do the null check inside that if-block again.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-hfvnpa

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Object is possibly 'null'.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 14.2.1
Node: 16.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0 
OS: linux x64

Angular: 14.2.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1402.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.2.1
@angular-devkit/core            14.2.1
@angular-devkit/schematics      14.2.1
@angular/cdk                    14.2.4
@angular/cli                    14.2.1
@angular/material               14.2.4
@schematics/angular             14.2.1
rxjs                            7.4.0
typescript                      4.8.3
```


### Anything else?

Issues.Title: Wrong redirect for documentation of version 12's changes and deprecations
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

[The _Update Angular_ page](https://angular.io/guide/update-to-latest-version), which [the URL which used to point to documentation of version 12's breaking changes](https://angular.io/guide/updating-to-version-12#breaking-changes-in-angular-version-12) now redirects to, does not document breaking changes in version 12. It only documents those of version 14.

There are obviously 2 ways to fix this:

1. Easiest: Redirect to [the new URL](https://v12.angular.io/guide/updating-to-version-12)
2. Best (I guess): Merging all upgrade information in https://angular.io/guide/update-to-latest-version

Thanks to @JoostK for [pointing out](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/47627#issuecomment-1267638974) where the documentation can be found.

Issues.Title: Angular & Node.js compatibility matrix
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

When working on different angular projects with different versions, sometimes I would find that I am using the wrong node.js version to install my node modules and only realize after trying to run the project. I then have to figure out which version to use and add a .nvmrc with the version for future reference. I don't see a reliable page on the documentation site that indicates which node version should be used for a specific version of Angular, rather I have to lookup changelog or blog information.

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

n/a

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

I think it would be useful to have a page with this information on the official site to make it convenient to know which version of node goes with which version of angular.

@LayZeeDK has written [Angular CLI, Angular, Node.js, TypeScript, and RxJS version compatibility matrix](https://gist.github.com/LayZeeDK/c822cc812f75bb07b7c55d07ba2719b3)

Which has been the most reliable source of this information for me. 

I would like something similar to perhaps appear under the "References" menu item.

I also believe he would be willing to assist with this work.

Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [esbuild](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild) | optionalDependencies | patch | [`0.15.10` -> `0.15.11`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/esbuild/0.15.10/0.15.11) |
| [esbuild](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild) | devDependencies | patch | [`0.15.10` -> `0.15.11`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/esbuild/0.15.10/0.15.11) |
| [esbuild-wasm](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild) | dependencies | patch | [`0.15.10` -> `0.15.11`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/esbuild-wasm/0.15.10/0.15.11) |
| [esbuild-wasm](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild) | devDependencies | patch | [`0.15.10` -> `0.15.11`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/esbuild-wasm/0.15.10/0.15.11) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild</summary>

### [`v0.15.11`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​01511)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.15.10...v0.15.11)

-   Fix various edge cases regarding template tags and `this` ([#​2610](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2610))

    This release fixes some bugs where the value of `this` wasn't correctly preserved when evaluating template tags in a few edge cases. These edge cases are listed below:

    ```js
    async function test() {
      class Foo { foo() { return this } }
      class Bar extends Foo {
        a = async () => super.foo``
        b = async () => super['foo']``
        c = async (foo) => super[foo]``
      }
      function foo() { return this }
      const obj = { foo }
      const bar = new Bar
      console.log(
        (await bar.a()) === bar,
        (await bar.b()) === bar,
        (await bar.c('foo')) === bar,
        { foo }.foo``.foo === foo,
        (true && obj.foo)`` !== obj,
        (false || obj.foo)`` !== obj,
        (null ?? obj.foo)`` !== obj,
      )
    }
    test()
    ```

    Each edge case in the code above previously incorrectly printed `false` when run through esbuild with `--minify --target=es6` but now correctly prints `true`. These edge cases are unlikely to have affected real-world code.

</details>

---

Issues.Title: [Angular 15] ng test: Add CLI flags to generate unit test report(xml) and code coverage report(Cobertura/JaCoCo) for CI
Issues.Body: ### Command test ### Description As per [Angular CLI v15 release notes](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/releases/tag/15.0.0-next.4), `karma.conf.js` file will no longer be generated by default for newly generated applications/libraries. What is the expected workflow for a developer to generate unit test report(xml) and code coverage report(Cobertura/JaCoCo) for Azure DevOps CI? Below are the tasks available to collect unit test and code coverage reports in Azure DevOps: - [Publish Test Results task](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/test/publish-test-results?view=azure-devops&tabs=trx%2Cyaml) ****** - [Publish Code Coverage Results task](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/test/publish-code-coverage-results?view=azure-devops) ****** Previous request: #21219 ### Describe the solution you'd like Provide CLI flags to generate unit test and code coverage reports `ng test --project command-center --no-watch --code-coverage --code-coverage-report-format cobertura --tests-report-format junit` Or, provide a command to generate a default `karma.conf.js` file `ng generate tests-config --project command-center` ### Describe alternatives you've considered _No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Angular 15] ng test: Add CLI flags to generate unit test report(xml) and code coverage report(Cobertura/JaCoCo) for CI" (#24094)

Issues.Title: Fails to `@import 'pkg/style.less'` on ubuntu
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

importing less styles using the `@import '@pkg/file.less'` syntax on Ubuntu results in an error. Meaning it's without `~`.
The less loader can't find the file.

`@import '@pkg/file.less'` works fine on Windows.

### Minimal Reproduction

Must be done on Ubuntu

1. ng new test-app --style less
2. then npm install ng-zorro-antd
3. add `@import 'ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less';` to /src/styles.less
4. ng build

### Exception or Error

```text
./src/styles.less - Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/less-loader/dist/cjs.js):


// -------- import official less file -----------
@import 'ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less';
^
Less resolver error:
'ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less' wasn't found. Tried - /mnt/c/Users/myuser/myproject/src/ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less,npm://ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less,ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less

Webpack resolver error details:
undefined

Webpack resolver error missing:
undefined


      Error in /mnt/c/Users/myuser/myproject/src/styles.less (line 2, column 0)

./src/styles.less - Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/loader.js):
HookWebpackError: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/less-loader/dist/cjs.js):


// -------- import official less file -----------
@import 'ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less';
^
Less resolver error:
'ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less' wasn't found. Tried - /mnt/c/Users/myuser/myproject/src/ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less,npm://ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less,ng-zorro-antd/ng-zorro-antd.less

Webpack resolver error details:
undefined

Webpack resolver error missing:
undefined


      Error in /mnt/c/Users/myuser/myproject/src/styles.less (line 2, column 0)
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 14.2.6
Node: 16.18.0
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: linux x64

Angular: 14.2.6
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1402.6
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.2.6
@angular-devkit/core            14.2.6
@angular-devkit/schematics      14.2.6
@schematics/angular             14.2.6
rxjs                            7.5.7
typescript                      4.7.4
```


### Anything else relevant?

I first spotted this issue when building my app via Github workflows as they use Ubuntu.
I was able to reproduce the issue using WSL.

```
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS
Release:        22.04
Codename:       jammy
```

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): resolve transitive dependencies in Sass when using Yarn PNP
Issues.Body:
Enhanced resolver is unable to resolve transitive dependencies in Sass when using Yarn PNP. The main reason for this is that Sass doesn't provide context on which file is requesting the module. See: https://github.com/sass/sass/issues/3247.

As a workaround for this we store previously resolved paths and when a new request comes in we try to resolve this from the previously resolved files if we are unable to resolve the request from the workspace root.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): resolve transitive dependencies in Sass when using Yarn PNP" (#24077)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/core): update logger `forEach` `promiseCtor` type
Issues.Body:

https://github.com/ReactiveX/rxjs/blob/afac3d574323333572987e043adcd0f8d4cff546/src/internal/Observable.ts#L311-L313

FYI @gunan

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): account for package.json exports fields with CSS import statements
Issues.Body: The `postcss-imports` package was previously used to support `@import` within CSS files. Unfortunately, the package does not account for `package.json` exports fields. This prevents imports defined within that field from working when used within a build.  The `css-loader` package does provide this functionality and is now used to provide support for CSS `@import` instead of `postcss-imports`. This change does not affect preprocessors that provide their own import behavior.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): account for package.json exports fields with CSS import statements" (#24071)

Issues.Title: Http Client in @angular-devkit/schematics
Issues.Body:
### Command

add

### Description

When I write a new schematic command, I would like to make some HTTPS calls to get data from Cloud.
For example, I would like to sync some content or configuration from Cloud to a Local project.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Making Angular HTTP Client available in Schematics commands 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I'm using external HTTP client

Issues.Title: bug: This npm package exports are probably wrong.
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I seems that no auto-import works anymore at the latest material version. Maybe wrong exports? What has been changed?

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new Angular project.
2. Add some material to it. ng add @angular/material
3. Try to import the `MatButtonModule` by directly writing it into the imports array.
4. Hit CTRL+Space in VSCode. "No suggestions" :(

Workaround add the path `node_modules/@angular/material` to `typeRoots` in `tsconfig.json`.
Restart VSCode. Now it works. But this is maybe not the best solution.


### Expected Behavior

Auto-imports should work.

### Actual Behavior

Auto-imports do not work.

### Environment

- Angular: 14.2.6
- CDK/Material: 14.2.5
- Browser(s): Doesn't matter.
- Operating System: Windows 10
- VSCode: 1.72.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug: This npm package exports are probably wrong." (#25828)

Issues.Title: help(mat-autocomplete): re-show select list with async data
Issues.Body:
### What are you trying to do?

Make filled autocomplete field show list of options for async data as it does for static data from the examples.

### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

Async pipe data won't allow autocomplete to show options after one has been selected.
Static data does.

### Reproduction

First and last example of angular material doc: https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete/examples

First example, "Highlight the first autocomplete option" won't show select list after selection, has async data.

Last example, "Simple autocomplete" show select list after selection, has static data.


### Environment

- Angular: 13 or 14
- CDK/Material: 13 or 14
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System: WSL2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "help(mat-autocomplete): re-show select list with async data" (#25827)

Issues.Title: feat(MDC-MIGRATION): Handle selectable MatChip
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Legacy MatChip has a selectable attribute, but this has been moved to MatChipOption.

mdc-migration should change mat-chip items containing selectable attribute to mat-chip-option.

Ideally, <mat-chip [selectable]="false"> should just remove the attribute.

### Use Case

Migration from Material 14 to 15 using MDC.

Issues.Title: feat(cdk/listbox): Add an option to set listbox options when cdkOptions are expected to change
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Add an Input option for the cdk/listbox, thats takes a list of options that overrides the options generated by the ContentChildren decorator. This enables the listbox to be used in contexts where the currently rendered CdkOptions change.

### Use Case

• Allows the use of virtual scrolling in combination with listbox, as virtual scrolling renderes only some options at a time. 

• Allows to filter/search the options, by rendering filtered options based on user input.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(cdk/listbox): Add an option to set listbox options when cdkOptions are expected to change" (#25822)

Issues.Title: fix(material/menu): custom origin in focusFirstItem not respected on open
Issues.Body:
A while ago we added an `NgZone.onStable` wrapper around the logic that moves focus in `MatMenu.focusFirstItem` in order to work around an issue with VoiceOver. Since focus is now delayed, calling `focusFirstItem` in quick succession with different origins may not work as expected.

These changes unsubscribe from the previous `onStable` callback if a new one comes in before it has finished.

Fixes #25658.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/menu): custom origin in focusFirstItem not respected on open" (#25812)

Issues.Title: bug(menu, drag and drop): host-context does not work on menu or drag and drop components
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using :host-context() with a menu or drag and drop component item, the styling is not applied.




### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Place a class called "parent-class" on a parent div
2. Place a class on the specific item that should be styled (when an ancestor component has the selector of .parent-class)
3. Apply 
:host-context(.parent-class) {
        .item-class {
             // some styling
        }
  }

See stackblitz for menu component: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-shpfzq?file=src/app/menu-overview-example.scss

See stackblitz for drag and drop component: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-vwsq5v?file=src/app/cdk-drag-drop-connected-sorting-group-example.css


### Expected Behavior

Styling should be applied when using :host-context() with an ancestor element's selector.

### Actual Behavior

Styling is not applied to menu or drag and drop component items when using :host-context() with an ancestor element's selector.

### Environment

- Angular: 14.0.0
- CDK/Material: 14.2.5
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(menu, drag and drop): host-context does not work on menu or drag and drop components" (#25816)

Issues.Title: bug(MatAutocomplete): MatAutocomplete + FormControl does not clear input correctly after option selection
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

See example: https://material.angular.io/components/chips/examples#chips-autocomplete

In this example, after selecting an autocomplete option, we want to create a new chip and clear the typed text in the input element. The input is bound to a FormControl instance, so it should be possible to clear the input by simply calling `this.fruitCtrl.setValue(null)` or `this.fruitCtrl.setValue('')`. Instead, the previously typed text remains visible, but if you subscribe to the `FormControl.valueChanges` property you will see the new empty value emitted correctly.

The example works around this issue by accessing the native input element and updating the value directly.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. See example https://material.angular.io/components/chips/examples#chips-autocomplete
2. Remove the nativeElement reference
3. Input text remains visible despite the FormControl instance correctly emitting the new value, creating an inconsistent state

### Expected Behavior

It should be enough to just update the FormControl to ensure the input element has the correct value set.

### Actual Behavior

The input element is left in an inconsistent state unless the user manually updates the native element's value directly.

### Environment

- Angular: n/a (internal stable version http://go/ng-cli)
- CDK/Material: n/a
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatAutocomplete): MatAutocomplete + FormControl does not clear input correctly after option selection" (#25809)

Issues.Title: bug(popups): Material popups shown from native HTML dialog appear behind dialog
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When components that display a popup (like Select or DateTIme) are placed inside a [native HTML dialog](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dialog), the popup appears behind the dialog rather than inside or in front of it.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open [this StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-fvl4bc?file=src/app/example-component.html)
2. Click the button to show the dialog
3. Click on the select and/or the calendar button


### Expected Behavior

The popup for the select and calendar are visible in front of the dialog and are interactable.

### Actual Behavior

The popups are obscured behind the dialog. The parts that appear behind it are not interactive because of the dialog overlay.

### Environment

- Angular: 14.1.3 (also reproduced in 12)
- CDK/Material: 14.1.3
- Browser(s): Reproduced in Safari, Firefox, and Chromium
- Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(popups): Material popups shown from native HTML dialog appear behind dialog" (#25799)
